page.title: 07CHURCH STRETTON BIRDLIFE
page.content: With the many habitats in the area the birdlife is rich and varied. In the ancient broadleafed woodlands birds twitter endlessly. On the seemingly desolate moors the variety of birdlife astounds the visiting birdwatcher. In the built up areas all the usual species can be seen. Many of the more unusual species such as {Merlin, Ring Ousel, Pied Flycatcher, {Spotted Flycatcher, Redstart, Buzzard, {and Dipper can be seen if you know where to look. The rarest bird must be the{Merlin} This spectacular, blackbird sized bird of prey is seen occasionally on the moorland in the area. Its prey is chiefly small birds caught in flight. Church Stretton is a great place to visit if you are an ornithologist.
